title: Why co-working spaces in India have startups and entrepreneurs hooked
details: The monumental work that follows starting up truly begins to manifest itself when investors and other stakeholders come knocking. As meetings on precarious subjects are scheduled with the weight of deadlines hanging in the balance, pending utility bills or malfunctioning internet networks may be enough to break the momentum. Sharing office space with existing establishments could serve as a quick fix. Fortunately, eliminating administrative hassles is, but the most basic benefit such collaborations have on offer.
blurb: What makes this concept click is the vast trove of possibilities it offers - you may just be paying for the 50 sq ft around your desk, but end up meeting passionate and innovative people to enrich your entrepreneurial journey.

title: No bumpy ride for startups as Narendra Modi government okays Rs 10,000 crore corpus; to generate 18 lakh jobs
details: NEW DELHI: The government today approved Rs 10,000 crore 'Fund of Funds for
blurb: The decision was taken in Union Cabinet meeting chaired by PM Modi. This is in line with the 'Startup India Action Plan' unveiled by the govt in January.

title: Zone Startups to manage Barclays' Rise accelerator programme in Mumbai
blurb: The recruitment process for the Rise accelerator will commence in early July and the first cohort will start in September. This would be a four month long program.

title: Great Indian startups some way off, will continue to support those with which I was involved: Softbank's Nikesh Arora
blurb: Arora, who helped back Indian startups with over $1 bn in SoftBank capital in less than a year, believes that founders need to focus on execution.

title: Tatas, Uber tie up for vehicle purchase, financing solutions
details: HYDERABAD: Tata Group today announced a tie-up with ride-sharing company
blurb: Under the partnership, those looking to operate Uber cars can buy Tata vehicles and also get access to flexible and customised financing solutions from Tata Capital and Tata Motors Finance.

title: Digital wallet company Freecharge announces partnership with Barista
details: MUMBAI: Digital payments and wallet company
blurb: Freecharge which had earlier partnered with McDonald's and Cafe Coffee Day, said that the partnership is aimed at making the bill payment process swifter and more secure for consumers.

title: Taxi aggregator Uber to expand presence to 50 cities by year-end
blurb: Uber currently has operations in 27 cities in India and will try to be in 50 cities by the end of year. It is looking to partner with local companies to expand its business.

title: Ola founder Bhavish Aggarwal aims to stop Uber's passage to India
blurb: Aggarwal contends Ola has a better grasp of how to operate in a country with infrastructure challenges like nowhere else.

title: Paytm to assist sellers in six more local languages
details: BENGALURU: In a move aimed at consolidating its seller marketplace, digital payments and
blurb: "Sellers can add new products, manage inventory and orders, and get payment details in the regional language app," said Sudhanshu Gupta of Paytm.

title: Assisted e-commerce startups spot promise in services
details: HYDERABAD: Until two years ago, Karunakar, who runs a convenience store in coastal Karnataka's Shiruru village, would go to a travel agent in the neighbouring town whenever he needed to book a bus ticket.
blurb: StoreKing's network spread across towns and villages in southern and western India, is one of the several startups that are offering assisted e-commerce.

title: Startup: Over 400 entrepreneurs queue up for tax benefits
details: NEW DELHI: Over 400 budding entrepreneurs have filed applications with the Department of Industrial Policy and Promotion (DIPP) for recognition as innovative startups to avail tax breaks and other benefits.
blurb: In January, PM Narendra Modi unveiled a slew of incentives to boost startups, offering them a tax holiday and inspector raj-free regime.

title: IFC to focus on startups in healthcare, edu-tech, consumer internet and clean technology sectors
details: NEW DELHI: International Finance Corp, the private sector investment arm of the
blurb: International Finance Corp, the private sector investment arm of the World Bank, is looking to ramp up its venture capital activity in India.

title: Kickstarter just did something tech startups never do: It paid a dividend
blurb: Kickstarter has promised to allocate five percent of profits to charitable ventures and pledged not to use loopholes or other legal strategies to reduce its tax burden.

title: Karnataka rules regressive, impossible to comply: Uber
blurb: Under the new rules, Karnataka has mandated ride-hailing start-ups to provide digital printers, install panic buttons and have taxi signage on their vehicles.

title: Foodpanda automates order flow, eyes profits in next three years
blurb: It has recently launched a service to ensure delivery within 45 minutes which will be available in Delhi, Pune, Hyderabad, Mumbai and Bengaluru.

title: My Enterprise: How Narendra Bansal grew Intex Tech turnover from Rs 1.18 cr to over Rs 6K cr
details: From clicking pictures using a borrowed camera, to establishing a billion-dollar company, it has been a remarkable journey for Narendra Bansal.
blurb: From clicking pictures using a borrowed camera, to establishing a billion-dollar company, it has been a remarkable journey for Narendra Bansal.

title: Ola drivers band with CITU to push for better payment systems
blurb: CITU leader Anbalagan spoke to cab drivers. He said:" We need to protest together. This problem s not just an Ola problem. Its larger than that."

title: How TaxZippy helps you file taxes and more
details: It's that time of the year when salaried
blurb: Started in 2016, the company is a late entrant compared to other startups like ClearTax, however the sheer scale of the opportunity offsets any disadvantage.

title: TaxiFabric: The startup that Coldplay's Chris Martin loved
blurb: Started as a blog in 2013 for art enthusiasts, it has today become a converging point for talented designers and taxi drivers to refashion interiors of cabs, sell hand-picked trendy fabrics, and much more.

title: Tata and Uber join hands to empower Uber drivers
blurb: Tata Opportunity Fund invested in Uber last year, and through the current partnership, Uber hopes to expand their franchise in India.

title: Tesla Motors picks China over India to set up manufacturing base
details: Shanghai has emerged as the front-runner to become the production base for
blurb: Shanghai has emerged as the front-runner to become the production base for Tesla in an investment that may be valued at about $9 billion.

title: Uber gets digital meters & physical panic buttons to comply with Karnataka government's guidelines
blurb: Interestingly, we found certain drivers with digital meter printers and a panic button already present in their vehicles in Bangalore over the weekend.

title: Association of cabbies, auto drivers seek inquiry against Ola, Uber
blurb: Scores of taxi-rickshaw owners and drivers protested over the transport charge of Rs 6 per km being offered by the aggregators to ferry commuters.

title: Schedulers Logistics raised Series- B round from GVFL
blurb: Schedulers was founded in 2012 by industry veterans Akshay Sharma and Colonel Arvind Gangoly. In 2014, Schedulers raised Series A capital from Aspada Investment Company.

title: Karnataka: Ola gets licence by registering and furnishing details for 100 cabs
blurb: The firm had earlier filed a petition challenging the Karnataka On-demand Transportation Technology Rules, 2016.

title: Ola to engage with SoftBank's executive-turned advisor Nikesh Arora
blurb: "I look forward to engaging with Arora in his role as an advisor to SoftBank in the time ahead," Ola co-founder and chief executive Bhavish Aggarwal said.

title: SAP partners with IIT-Bombay to run an accelerator program, innovation centre
blurb: SAP tied up with the Society for Innovation and Entrepreneurship (SINE), a technology and business incubator at the IIT campus to run the startup accelerator.

title: Mayors worldwide align in response to Airbnb, Uber for a unified rule book
blurb: Representatives for cities that also includes Athens, Barcelona and Toronto, have started their first concerted effort to produce a common framework.

title: Fresco Capital, e-Zest Solutions team up for hackathon in Pune
blurb: About 300 developers are expected to build bots on the Facebook, Slack and Microsoft platform, giving both Fresco and e-Zest access to some new ideas in machine learning, AI and more.

title: Govin Capital to set up Startup Accelerator India Pune Chapter in collaboration with SEED INfotech
blurb: Govind Academy, a sister concern of Govin Capital will also collaborate with Seed Infotech to set up the International Centre for Entrepreneurship.

title: India, Israel can greatly benefit from each other's startup ecosystems: Nasscom's R Chandrashekhar
blurb: "The Israeli government grants nearly 80% funds to early-stage startups. It will be interesting to know how this model can be incorporated into the Indian startup space."

title: How the startup boom is helping farmers and forcing investors to pay attention to agriculture
details: Balu Mhaske, a farmer in Maharashtra's Yevati village, has been growing marigold flowers on his 10-acre farm the past 15 years. Whatever he couldn't sell went waste, which used to be a lot at times. That changed last year when he began renting a solar-powered cold-storage unit to keep his flowers.
blurb: More and more startups are developing a a wide range of products to make life easier for farmers. Investors have taken note of the sector's potential.

title: Taxi-hailing app Uber rolls out 'upfront fares' in India, US
blurb: The fare will be calculated on the basis of expected travel time, distance, traffic, surge and tolls where applicable.

title: Is job of cab driver in aggregators service like Ola,Uber and Meru lucrative?
details: Hari Singh used to work for Powerica, a power generation company, until a few months ago. He was part of the team that supplied electric generators during the construction of the Bandra-Worli Sea Link in Mumbai.
blurb: The service was new, affordable and hassle-free when compared with autorickshaws and regular cab services across metros.

title: A serial entrepreneur on why starting up is tough but every bit worth it
blurb: The social stigma attached to being unemployed and unemployable, which was how an entrepreneur was viewed two decades ago, is not there anymore.

title: TechProcess looks to learn a few lessons in education space
blurb: TechProcess currently has 650 education institutes such as BITS Pilani and Amity University on board, and processed Rs 140 crore in spend from the education sector in FY16.

title: Shopclues expects over two-fold jump in Gross Merchandise Volume sales this fiscal
blurb: "We are planning to close financial year 2016-17 at annualised GMV rate of $ 3 billion," Shopclues Chief Business Officer Radhika Ghai Aggarwal told PTI.

title: Hopes for startups waning as unicorn race slows down in pace
blurb: Named the Year of the Unicorn by several market players, 2015 was largely considered to be one of the most fruitful years in the history of the global start-up industry.

title: Amazon's cloud business plans pop-up loft in Bengaluru for growth lift-off
blurb: The lofts, which offer everything from open workspaces to consulting to networking services, are essentially hubs for entrepreneurs.

title: Entrepreneurs launch web series, online reality programme backing new business ideas
blurb: Entrepreneurs, bitten by the startup bug and enterprises seeking to leverage Indias startup boom, have launched similar web series or webisodes, podcasts that backs new business ideas.

title: Capgemini is looking to partner with startups in India from fields of data analytics, IoT
details: HYDERABAD: French multinational Capgemini is looking to partner with startups in
blurb: After collaborating with startups in the US and Europe, the company is now scouting for some promising startups in Delhi, Mumbai and Bengaluru.

title: Virat Kohli starts new venture Stepathlon to tackle fitness issues affecting kids
blurb: The venture, called Stepathlon Kids, seeks to tackle fitness issues affecting kids by taking them through to a 30-day pedometer-based virtual race that will help increase awareness on health issues.

title: Online marketplace Paytm will deliver on same day in 20 cities
blurb: At present, the marketplace ships close to Rs 20-crore worth orders in a month through its same-day delivery service.

title: When those meant to be executives become startup founders, everyone loses
blurb: One of the most dangerous results of investing in the wrong founders is that it has an effect on the larger ecosystem.

title: Yumchek eyes India, Singapore for growth
blurb: For the restaurants, Yumchek brings in a predictive element that can help them plan better based on the insights and data analytics received.

title: Five Star Business Credits raises Rs 114 crore from Morgan Stanley Private Equity Asia
blurb: Five Stars typical clients include tea shop owners, vegetable vendors, small machine owners, provision stores, waste paper recycling units, tailors, and power looms.

title: Online jewellery marketplace VelvetCase.com raises $1.5 million in second round of funding
details: BENGALURU: Online jewellery marketplace VelvetCase.com has raised $1.5 million in a second round of funding led by Uniqorn Ventures Fund, with participation from investors
blurb: VelvetCase will use the money to expand its technology, marketing and seller acquisition services, the company said.

title: Ride hailing app Uber hits back at Ola's allegations
blurb: Ola has been granted a licence by Karnataka while transport officials have made known their displeasure with Uber by not accepting its application .

title: 3D design firm Autodesk joins major MNCs looking to tap into startup ecosystem in India
blurb: The company, whose software was used to create special effects in blockbuster film `Avatar,' is launching a design and innovation centre in Bengaluru.

title: Airbnb seeks funds valuing it at $30 billion: Source
blurb: Airbnb intends to use the financing to support new investments and growth opportunities, the source added.
